results.title: Erskineville kings
results.creator_credit: Julio Caro, Alan White, Beyond Films and @Radical Media
results.brief_description: Barky (Marty Denniss) returns to Sydney after a two-year absence when he hears of the death of his father. He is reunited with his brother (Hugh Jackman) and friends and we learn about their unresolved issues with each other and their father. Cast includes Aaron Blabey, Andrew Wholley, Joel Edgerton and Leah Vandenberg. First time feature produced and directed by Alan White.

results.title: Erin Brockovich [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Columbia Picture, Jersey Films, Danny DeVito, Michael Shamberg, Stacey Sher and Steven Soderbergh
results.brief_description: Erin Brockovich (Julia Roberts) is a single mother raising three young children. Failing to win a law suit following an automobile accident, she begins work as a secretary for lawyer Ed Masry where she stumbles over a small case against Pacific Gas and Electric. Further investigation reveals the company is responsible for contaminating the town’s water supply and contributing to the illnesses of a number of families. With Ed’s help, Erin files a law suit on behalf of the families involved. Based on a true story.

results.title: Eraserhead
results.creator_credit: American Film Institute, Lynch/Frost Productions and David Lynch
results.brief_description: Lynch’s debut film has been re-released with a new print and stereo mix soundtrack. Opinion is divided as to film’s brilliance but over the years it has achieved cult status in it’s genre. Shot in black and white with an incredible soundtrack and tight script, ‘Eraserhead’ is the story of a timid printer Henry Spencer (John Nance) who lives in an apartment building trying to figure out what to do with his horribly mutated son. Lynch described the film as ” a dream of dark and troubling things.”

results.title: Entertaining angels
results.creator_credit: Paulist Pictures, Elwood Kieser and Michael Rhodes
results.brief_description: ‘Entertaining Angels’ is based on the true life of Dorothy Day, a radical journalist who lived in New York writing about the plight of America’s homeless. She has an early love affair with a co-worker which results in a traumatic abortion that sees her move to the coast to be alone. While staying at the beach Dorothy (Moira Kelly) comes across and old friend and the two fall in love. It is at this time that Dorothy begins to question her faith after some close contact with one of the nuns who runs a shelter for the disadvantaged. Dorothy falls pregnant to Foster and although happy for a while, she refuses to give up her religion and he refuses to marry, once again Dorothy is alone but ready to move back to the city. Dorothy and her daughter are baptized Catholics and Dorothy resumes her career as a journalist, only this time starting her own paper, “The Catholic Worker” after meeting Peter, a French social activist. Dorothy combines her journalism and charity at home, offering the homeless a soup kitchen, shelter and office where she can work on the paper. This is an inspiring film that was made on a relatively small budget by Paulist Pictures who also brought us ‘Romero’.

results.title: Enemy of the State
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Scott Free Productions, Jerry Bruckheimer and Tony Scott
results.brief_description: In this action thriller from director Tony Scott, Will Smith plays Robert Clayton Dean, an innocent everyman who gets caught up in espionage, murder and government corruption. When Robert is handed a tape with damning evidence, he discovers there is no hiding from the insidious technology that tracks his every move. Robert seeks the aid of former covert operative Brill - Gene Hackman in a role that references his iconic Harry Caul from key 1970s paranoid thriller “The Conversation”. Cast also includes Jon Voight, Gabriel Byrne, Jason Robards.

results.title: Enemy mine
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Stephen J. Friedman and Wolfgang Petersen
results.brief_description: Dennis Quaid and Louis Gossett Jnr star in this science fiction tale of a human and an alien Draque - two races who have been taught to hate one another from birth. Earthman Davidge (Quaid) and Draque Jebira Shigan (Gossett Jnr) are both stranded on the deserted planet Tyrine IV and must rely on one another to survive, giving each an appreciation and understanding of the other they would not have thought possible. When Jebira dies giving birth to Zammis, a new era begins. Elation turns to tragedy years later when a spaceship lands on the planet, occupied by brutal men who keep Draques as slaves. While trying to protect Zammis, Davidge is shot, presumed dead and Zammis is taken prisoner aboard the ship…

results.title: Enemy at the gates [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Mandalay Pictures, Jean-Jacques Annaud and John Schofield
results.brief_description: In 1942 with World War II raging, the battle for Stalingrad becomes a focal point for the Nazi war against Europe and in particular Russia. A simple farm boy and talented sharpshooter named Vassili gains notoriety for his ability to kill German military officers. Danilov, a Soviet political propagandist working for Krushchev builds Vassili into a military hero in order to boost flagging military morale. In retaliation the Nazi’s send their best sniper, Major Koenig, to Russia to kill Vassili, who has become a symbol of potential Russian victory. As Koenig and Vassili set trap and counter-trap for each other, Danilov and Vassili come to loggerheads over a Russian soldier Tanya, whom they both love. Set in a spectacularly decaying city, “Enemy at the gates” successfully evokes the gruesome brutality and chaos of World War II as well as the ruthless machinations of the Russian propaganda machine. Purportedly the most expensive production to be shot in Europe, the film stars Jude Law, Bob Hoskins, Rachel Weisz, Joseph Fiennes and Ed Harris.

results.title: Enemies: a love story
results.brief_description: The quietly haunting tale of an aloof Jewish intellectual (Ron Silver) who managed to escape the Nazis and now in 1949 is living a double life in New York, married to a simple peasant girl who protected him during the war, and fooling around with a sexy Jewish woman who is desperate to marry him. Into all this walks his first wife Tamara (Anjelica Huston) whom reappears after being presumed killed during the war. Will Herman be able to please his three wives? This touching and humorous story is based on the novel by Isaac Bashevis Singer and lovingly brought to the screen by Paul Mazursky with all of Singer’s wit, irony and heartbreak.

results.title: Encounters of the spooky kind
results.creator_credit: Bo Ho Films, Raymond Chow and Samo Hung
results.brief_description: Encounters of the Spooky Kind, directed by icon of kung-fu cinema Samo Hung, has been credited with establishing the unique horror sub-genre of hopping vampire films, most vividly demonstrated by the Mr. Vampire series. A bizarre blend of slapstick, martial arts and the supernatural, this film follows the adventures of Cheung the Brave, an impoverished cart driver plagued by bad luck and a shrewish wife who is conducting an affair with his wealthy boss, Master Tam. After narrowly avoiding being caught one afternoon, Tam resolves to have Cheung eliminated by having a man dare him to spend a night in a haunted temple, and then paying Chin Hoi, a corrupt Taoist sorcerer, to raise a vampire to kill him. Cheung, unable to resist both a dare and the chance to prove his bravery, accepts, but is saved from certain death by his kung-fu skills and the advice of the sorcerer’s brother Tsui, who decides to help him defeat those who were plotting against him. Utilising his superior kung-fu abilities and a variety of vampire deterrents including chicken eggs, uncooked rice and a brew of dog’s legs and blood, he manages to ward off the vampire for a second night, only to be framed for the alleged murder of his wife. Escaping, Cheung finds himself caught up in a feud that eventually culminates in an explosive magical showdown between the warring brothers. As the evil incantations fly, Cheung, possessed by the spirit of the Monkey God, and Master Tam, possessed by the War God, are pitted against each other in a supernatural duel to the death. Stars Samo Hung as Cheung the Brave, Ha Wong as Master Tam, Lung Chan as Chin Hoi, and Fat Chung as Tsui. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Enchanted April
results.creator_credit: BBC Film Unit, Miramax Films, Greenpoint, Ann Scott and Mike Newell
results.brief_description: In a beautifully played ensemble piece four Englishwomen desert their dull and oppressive lives in post World War I London and escape to the Italian Riviera for a months holiday in a majestic castle. Once there, the castle and its magnificent surroundings work a special magic on the four women. Each find their worries slowly disappearing, their personalities changing and together, the four discover a friendship unknown to the likes of any of them before. Stars Miranda Richardson, Joan Plowright, Polly Walker and Josie Lawrence. From the novel by Elizabeth Von Arnim.
